title: Disordered Eating Behaviors and Weight Regain in Patients After Bariatric Surgery
content: Background/objective: Weight regain after bariatric surgery has serious health consequences, and disordered eating behaviors (DEB) may be involved in it. We compared DEB symptoms after bariatric surgery between patients with low vs. high ratio of weight regain (RWR) and investigated associations between DEB symptoms with weight regain and time since surgery. Meth-od: Ninety-four patients who had undergone laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass or sleeve gastrectomy and had not attended follow-up with the multidisciplinary healthcare team for at least one year were recruited.
